item.title: Parliament Winter Session LIVE: ‘Rahul clueless on pages in Constitution', says Thakur - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session LIVE: BJP invokes Emergency to counter Rahul Gandhi's attacks

Publication Date: December 14, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

During the second day of the Winter Session of Parliament, important discussions took place regarding the Constitution, with prominent debates between the ruling party and the opposition highlighting ongoing political tensions.

  • The Lok Sabha holds a special debate on the Constitution, celebrating its 75th anniversary.
  • Rahul Gandhi accused the BJP of using Emergency tactics to suppress dissent.
  • Priyanka Gandhi Vadra delivered her maiden speech, criticizing the government for failing to support citizens.
  • The BJP countered opposition claims, specifically targeting Rahul Gandhi's remarks on the Constitution and historical figures.
  • Upcoming discussions on the 'One Nation, One Election' bill, sparking controversy among opposition parties.
"The Constitution is a document of modern India, but it could never have been written without ancient India, her ideas." - Rahul Gandhi

This Parliament session has showcased the ongoing clash between the BJP and Congress, with leaders vying to define their narratives around the nation's constitutional identity and current political issues.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi's Lok Sabha speech on Constitution debate: Key quotes - The Times of India
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: 'Really surprised': Matthew Hayden reacts to Rohit's bold decision on Day 1 of Gabba Test - The Times of India
item.description:
'Really surprised': Matthew Hayden reacts to Rohit's bold decision on Day 1 of Gabba Test

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Former Australian opener Matthew Hayden expressed surprise at Rohit Sharma's bold decision to bowl first on the opening day of the Gabba Test, given that the pitch conditions seemed more suited for batting.

  • Hayden was taken aback by Rohit's toss decision, stating that the pitch favored batters.
  • He noted that the groundsman had likely prepared the pitch earlier due to recent rain, affecting its behavior.
  • India's bowlers struggled against Australia, who ended the day at 28/0 in 13.2 overs.
  • Hayden believes that the pitch will deteriorate over the next couple of days, making spinners more effective.
“I was really surprised that actually, Rohit won the toss and decided to bowl, because I felt like it was over-prepared... Almost 12 inches of rain in the past two weeks." - Matthew Hayden

In conclusion, Hayden emphasized that opting to bat first would have been a wiser choice, considering the expected changes in pitch conditions over the course of the match.

item.title: Viswanathan Anand Responds As Ex-World Champion Criticises D Gukesh's Title Triumph - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Viswanathan Anand Responds As Ex-World Champion Criticises D Gukesh's Title Triumph

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

Legendary chess player Viswanathan Anand promised support for D. Gukesh, who faced criticism regarding his World Championship victory over Ding Liren. Anand emphasized that criticism is part of achieving success and praised Gukesh's historic triumph.

  • D. Gukesh becomes the youngest chess world champion by defeating Ding Liren.
  • Critiques from former champion Vladimir Kramnik question the quality of the match.
  • Magnus Carlsen also criticizes the earlier rounds, calling them uncharacteristic for World Championship contenders.
  • Anand advises Gukesh to ignore the criticism and reflects on the importance of his achievement.
  • Anand highlights Gukesh's strong performance in recent competitions leading to his championship win.
"To be honest, I think it just comes with the territory. You ignore it and that's all." - Viswanathan Anand

In conclusion, Anand views Gukesh's victory as a significant milestone in Indian chess, celebrating the new generation's achievements despite the surrounding criticism.

item.title: 'Nahi ho raha swing' - Jasprit Bumrah's frustration an early worry for India in Gabba Test - The Times of India
item.description:
Nahi ho raha swing - Jasprit Bumrah's frustration an early worry for India in Gabba Test

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: Times of India

In the third Test against Australia at the Gabba, Indian captain Rohit Sharma opted to bowl first under cloudy conditions. However, Jasprit Bumrah expressed his frustration over the lack of swing during the early overs.

  • Rohit Sharma chose to bowl first despite expectations of a favorable pitch for fast bowlers.
  • Bumrah was heard on the stump microphone saying, "Nahin ho raha swing aise bhi; kahin bhi kar lo", indicating the ball was not swinging.
  • The first day was disrupted by rain, with only 13.2 overs bowled, leaving Australia at 28 for 0 by the end.
  • Indian bowlers experimented with different lines but failed to get swing or seam movement.
  • Former players and commentators expressed concerns about the decision to bowl first at the Gabba, citing historical context.
"You bat at the Gabba. If you face Australia, you want them to bat second and fourth." - Kerry O'Keeffe

This situation highlights ongoing challenges for India in the Test series and raises questions about their bowling strategy in conditions that did not provide the expected advantages.

item.title: Imad, Amir announce retirement from international cricket - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Imad, Amir announce retirement from international cricket

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: PCB Statement

Imad Wasim and Mohammad Amir have announced their retirement from international cricket, expressing gratitude to fans and the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) for their support throughout their careers.

  • Imad Wasim mentioned the fulfillment of a dream representing Pakistan.
  • He expressed gratitude to fans and the PCB, wishing success for the national team.
  • Mohammad Amir emphasized the honor of playing for Pakistan in all formats.
  • Amir believes it is time for the next generation to take over in Pakistan cricket.
  • Both players thanked fans for their support and the PCB for their assistance over the years.
“It has been a great journey representing my country... I wish great success to the national team.” – Imad Wasim
“It has been a great honour to play for Pakistan... I feel this is the right time for the next generation to take the baton.” – Mohammad Amir

Both Imad Wasim and Mohammad Amir leave behind a legacy of dedication to Pakistan cricket, prompting a hopeful outlook for its future with new players.

item.title: South Korea President Yoon Suk Yeol impeached over his martial law order - The Hindu
item.description:
South Korea President Yoon Suk Yeol impeached over his martial law order

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: The Hindu

South Korea’s parliament has voted to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol over his short-lived martial law declaration this month, marking a significant political event in the country.

  • The National Assembly passed the impeachment motion with a vote of 204-85.
  • Yoon’s presidential powers will be suspended pending the Constitutional Court's decision on his impeachment.
  • The court has up to 180 days to decide Yoon's fate; if removed, a national election must be held within 60 days.
  • Yoon stated he will “never give up” and called for stability during this “temporary” pause of his presidency.
  • The martial law decree drew comparisons to South Korea's authoritarian past from the 1980s.
“I will fight to the end in the face of opposition-led efforts to remove me from office.” - President Yoon Suk Yeol

The unexpected impeachment reflects deep political tensions in South Korea, and Yoon's fate now lies in the hands of the Constitutional Court. The upcoming decision will be crucial for the future political landscape of the nation.

item.title: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol Impeached Over Failed Martial Law Bid - NDTV
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: 'Harassment by ED, BJP leaders': Purported suicide note of MP businessman, wife sparks political slugfest - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Harassment by ED, BJP leaders: Purported suicide note of MP businessman, wife sparks political slugfest

Published: 14 December 2024, Source: PTI

Bhopal: A purported suicide note recovered after the deaths of a businessman and his wife in Madhya Pradesh's Sehore district has ignited a political dispute between the Congress and the ruling BJP.

  • The suicide note reportedly accuses the Enforcement Directorate (ED) and BJP leaders of harassment.
  • Manoj Parmar urged Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to care for his children in the note, saying the couple were supporters of the party.
  • Congress claims harassment led to the couple's deaths, labeling it a state-sponsored murder.
  • BJP leaders condemned the politically charged accusations, calling them a misuse of tragedy for personal gain.
  • The ED conducted searches linked to Parmar under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act prior to the incident.
"The deceased's only crime was that during our leader Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra, his children had supported the yatra by gifting him a piggy bank." - Kamal Nath

The investigation continues, with calls for thorough examination of the circumstances surrounding the tragic deaths amid rising political tension.

item.title: Naga Chaitanya, Rana Daggubati, Vijay Deverakonda meet Pushpa 2 star Allu Arjun after his release from jail. Watch videos - The Indian Express
item.description:
Naga Chaitanya, Rana Daggubati, Vijay Deverakonda meet Pushpa 2 star Allu Arjun after his release from jail. Watch videos.

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: Indian Express

After his emotional release from jail, Allu Arjun received a warm welcome from his friends and family, including notable actors and the director of his film Pushpa 2.

  • Allu Arjun was released from jail after being arrested in connection with a tragic incident at a screening of his film.
  • Vijay Deverakonda, Naga Chaitanya, Rana Daggubati, and director Sukumar were present to greet him.
  • Many videos and photos of the reunion were shared on social media.
  • The actor had spent a night in Chanchalguda jail before being released.
“Vijay Deverakonda visiting #AlluArjun shows real brotherhood, fans love this bond!” — Madhu (@MadhuOmNamo)

Allu Arjun's lawyer claimed that the prison authorities didn’t release him on time despite receiving the bail order. The incident leading to his arrest involved a stampede that resulted in the death of a woman and injuries to her son.

The outpouring of support from his friends and the public emphasizes the strong connections within the film community and the ongoing love for Allu Arjun among fans.

item.title: Atul Subhash Suicide | Accused-Wife Moves Allahabad High Court Seeking Anticipatory Bail In Abetment To... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Atul Subhash Suicide | Accused-Wife Moves Allahabad High Court Seeking Anticipatory Bail In Abetment To

Publication Date: December 14, 2024 | Source: Live Law

The wife of Atul Subhash, a 34-year-old techie from Bangalore who allegedly died by suicide, has filed for anticipatory bail in connection with an FIR accusing her and her family of abetting his suicide.

  • Atul Subhash left a 'justice is due' placard and a 24-page suicide note before his death.
  • He recorded an 81-minute video detailing the harassment he faced from his wife, Nikita Singhania, during their legal disputes.
  • An FIR was lodged against Nikita and her family by Atul's brother, claiming abetment to suicide.
  • Nikita and three family members have filed an anticipatory bail plea with the Allahabad High Court.
  • A PIL has been filed in the Supreme Court seeking reforms in domestic violence and dowry laws to protect husbands and their families.

#JustIn #AtulSubhashSuicideCase | An anticipatory bail petition has been filed by his wife, Nikita Singhania, and three of her family members before the #AllahabadHighCourt in connection with an FIR filed against them over abetment to suicide case.

This case highlights the complexities surrounding domestic disputes and mental health, raising important discussions on legal protections in familial conflicts.

item.title: 'Nahi ho raha...': Jasprit Bumrah's anguish caught on stump mic before rain crashes Day 1 of India vs Australia 3rd Test - Hindustan Times
item.description:
'Nahi ho raha...': Jasprit Bumrah's anguish caught on stump mic before rain crashes Day 1 of India vs Australia 3rd Test

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Rain disrupted Day 1 of the third Test between India and Australia at the Gabba, allowing only 13.2 overs of play. The highlight was a moment captured on the stump mic featuring Jasprit Bumrah expressing his frustration.

  • Rohit Sharma won the toss and opted to bowl first under overcast conditions.
  • Jasprit Bumrah struggled to find swing and indicated to Shubman Gill during play that the ball wasn't swinging as expected.
  • Usman Khawaja and Nathan McSweeney faced the Indian bowlers comfortably, contributing to Australia's score of 28/0 before rain halted play.
  • The play is scheduled to resume with adjusted timings at 5:20 AM IST, contingent on weather conditions.

“Nahi ho raha swing aise bhi (The ball isn't swinging),” Jasprit Bumrah expressed to Shubman Gill after his delivery.

As both teams prepare for the resumption, memories of India's historic win at the Gabba in 2020-21 loom large, with Rishabh Pant sharing his positive outlook about returning to the venue.

item.title: Saturday fun, Sunday regret: What’s the worrying trend about ‘weekend’ drinking - The Tribune India
item.description:
Saturday fun, Sunday regret: What’s worrying about ‘weekend’ drinkers is it has 88% Indians aged under 25

Publication Date: Not provided

Source: The Tribune

In India, a troubling trend among young adults has emerged, with 88% of individuals under 25 consuming alcohol, particularly during weekends, leading to potential long-term consequences.

  • “Weekend” alcoholics are those who drink heavily on Friday and Saturday nights but abstain during the week.
  • Alcohol sales have increased by 8% over the past three years, with one-fifth of drinkers identified as dependent on alcohol.
  • The average age of first-time drinkers has dropped from 19 to 13 years in the last decade.
  • Spirits make up 95% of the beverages consumed in India, raising concerns due to their high alcohol content.
  • Alcohol consumption in India has surged from 4.86 billion litres in 2020 to an estimated 6.21 billion litres in 2024.
“Over 88% Indians aged under 25 drink alcohol.”

This article highlights the growing concern of alcohol consumption among young adults in India and the implications of weekend drinking habits that may lead to dependency and health issues.

item.title: Ranbir-Alia channel Raj Kapoor-core, Saif-Kareena bring Nawabi flair to greatest showman's centenary celebrations - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ranbir-Alia channel Raj Kapoor-core, Saif-Kareena bring Nawabi flair to greatest showman's centenary celebrations

Date: Dec 14, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The celebrations marking the centenary of Raj Kapoor brought together prominent members of the Kapoor family, showcasing stunning fashion and honoring the legacy of Indian cinema's greatest showman.

  • Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt opened the event at the Prime Minister's residence, inviting guests to a celebration in Mumbai.
  • Ranbir donned a midnight velveteen bandhgala, resembling Raj Kapoor, while Alia wore a vintage-inspired Sabyasachi saree.
  • Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan showcased their Nawabi heritage with elegant traditional attire.
  • Vicky Kaushal also captured attention with a sharp pinstriped suit, adding to the evening's fashion highlight.
  • Fashion trends of the night leaned heavily on retro styles, celebrating the iconic era of the 60s.
"Alia looked sophisticated-ly sultry while Saif and Kareena looked every bit the Nawab and Begum."

The night was a grand salute to the legacy of Raj Kapoor, as stars paid tribute through their attire, embodying the essence and glamour of Indian cinema’s rich history.

item.title: NASA's Juno mission uncovers heart of Jovian moon's volcanic rage - CGTN
item.description:
NASA's Juno mission uncovers heart of Jovian moon's volcanic rage

Publication Date: December 14, 2024 | Source: Xinhua News Agency

Scientists with NASA's Juno mission have revealed new insights into the volcanic activity of Jupiter's moon Io, showing that each volcano is likely powered by individual chambers of magma rather than a single ocean of magma.

  • The finding addresses a 44-year-old mystery regarding Io's volcanic activity.
  • Io, similar in size to Earth's moon, is the most volcanically active body in the solar system, with approximately 400 volcanoes.
  • The Juno spacecraft conducted close flybys of Io in December 2023 and February 2024, achieving proximity of about 1,500 kilometers to its surface.
  • Juno collected high-precision data to analyze Io's gravity and the effects of tidal flexing on the moon.
"Juno's discovery that tidal forces do not always create global magma oceans does more than prompt us to rethink what we know about Io's interior," - Ryan Park, Juno co-investigator.

The insights gained from Juno's mission may also reshape our understanding of other celestial bodies and have broader implications for the study of planetary formation and evolution.

item.title: 'One Nation, One Election' : How Constitution Is Proposed To Be Amended For Simultaneous Elections To Lok ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
One Nation, One Election: How Constitution Is Proposed To Be Amended For Simultaneous Elections To Lok

Publication Date: Not specified Source: LiveLaw

The 'One Nation, One Election' Bill aims to amend the Constitution to facilitate simultaneous elections for the Lok Sabha and all Legislative Assemblies. The Bill is set to be tabled in Parliament and proposes significant changes to existing electoral laws.

  • The Bill seeks to insert Article 82A for simultaneous elections to the House of the People and all Legislative Assemblies.
  • It also amends Articles 83, 172, and 327 regarding the duration and conduct of elections.
  • Simultaneous elections mean general elections held together for the Lok Sabha and all Legislative Assemblies.
  • Provisions include how mid-term elections will be managed and their alignment for Union Territories.
"There was an imperative need for holding of simultaneous elections. The imposition of Model Code of Conduct in various parts of the country which are poll-bound puts on hold the entire development programs." - Government Statement

The proposed amendments focus on streamlining the electoral process, addressing inefficiencies caused by staggered elections, and aligning legislative terms to enhance governance and development.

item.title: Pushpa 2 Box Office Collections: Allu Arjun starrer holds well on second Friday, rises to 850cr in India - PINKVILLA
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Box Office Collections: Allu Arjun starrer holds well on second Friday, rises to 850cr in India

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024 | Source: Pinkvilla

Pushpa 2 has achieved impressive box office success, grossing a total of Rs. 853 crore in India, approaching the Rs. 1000 crore milestone.

  • On its second Friday, Pushpa 2 earned approximately Rs. 42.50 crore.
  • The film experienced minimal collection drops and even some growth in Telugu states from Thursday.
  • Pushpa 2’s second Friday gross is the second highest of all time, trailing only Baahubali 2.
  • The film has already surpassed Rs. 1000 crore worldwide as of Wednesday.
  • Territorial box office breakdown shows AP/TS leading with Rs. 234.50 crore, followed by the Hindi Belt at Rs. 485 crore.

“It was essential for it to hold well on the second Friday to hope for a strong second-week hold, and the film has done better than it probably needed to.”

Pushpa 2 is on course to challenge the box office record held by Baahubali 2 as it continues its successful run in theaters.

item.title: What Priyanka Gandhi meant when she told BJP: ‘Learn from us on Emergency, you too apologise’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
What Priyanka Gandhi meant when she told BJP: ‘Learn from us on Emergency, you too apologise’

Publication Date: Recent | Source: Indian Express

In her inaugural speech in Parliament, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra addressed the BJP's criticisms regarding the Emergency, urging them to acknowledge their own mistakes and fight fair elections.

  • Priyanka Gandhi spoke during a special debate on the Constitution, challenging BJP leaders.
  • She quoted Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, suggesting that the BJP should apologize for its mistakes.
  • Congress leaders, including Rahil Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi, have previously acknowledged the Emergency as a “mistake.”
  • Historian Pranab Mukherjee described the Emergency as a "misadventure" in his writings.
  • Shashi Tharoor highlighted that the Emergency was "undemocratic" but not "unconstitutional."
“What happened in the Emergency is wrong. Let us not go back and forth on it.” — Jyotiraditya Scindia

The Congress party has a history of reflecting on the Emergency, with leaders admitting its faults while navigating complex discussions around accountability and historical context.

item.title: E.V.K.S. Elangovan, senior Congress leader and Erode (East) MLA, no more - The Hindu
item.description:
E.V.K.S. Elangovan, senior Congress leader and Erode (East) MLA, no more

Publication Date: December 14, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Former chief of the Tamil Nadu Congress Committee (TNCC) and former Union Minister of State, E.V.K.S. Elangovan, passed away in Chennai on Saturday morning after a brief illness at the age of 73.

  • Mr. Elangovan was admitted to MIOT hospital on November 13.
  • He is survived by his wife and a son.
  • He represented Erode (East), a seat previously held by his deceased son, E. Thirumahan Everaa.
  • He was a prominent figure in Tamil Nadu politics, serving as TNCC president twice.
  • He was also a former Union Minister of State, with responsibilities in key sectors such as Petroleum and Commerce.
"He held the post of TNCC president twice - 2000 to 2002 and 2014 to 2016 when the party was increasingly getting marginalised in the State politics."

With a notable political lineage, Mr. Elangovan's contributions to the Congress party and Tamil Nadu politics have left a lasting impact.

item.title: 10 signs on your face and body that say your hands are not clean - The Times of India
item.description:
10 signs on your face and body that say your hands are not clean

Publication Date: Not provided | Source: Not specified

Hygiene is crucial for good health, and there are often overlooked signs on your face and body that indicate your hands may not be clean. These symptoms, such as outbreaks and inflammation, emphasize the importance of hand hygiene.

  • Eye infections may occur from rubbing eyes with unclean hands, leading to conditions like conjunctivitis.
  • Skin infections can arise when germs transfer from dirty hands to cuts or scrapes.
  • Touching the mouth or nose with unwashed hands can lead to frequent colds and flu.
  • Chapped lips may result from bacteria and dirt transferring to sensitive skin from dirty hands.
  • Nail infections can develop due to germs under the nails, caused by inadequate hand hygiene.
  • Frequent acne may be linked to touching the face with unclean hands, which clogs pores.
  • Rashes or allergic reactions can be triggered by transferring irritants from dirty hands to sensitive skin.
  • Eczema symptoms may flare up due to contamination from unclean hands.
  • Stomach troubles, including food poisoning, can result from bacteria on dirty hands entering the digestive system.
  • Body odour can develop when bacteria from unclean hands transfer to clothing or skin.
"Proper hand hygiene can efficiently prevent health risks associated with dirty hands."

Practicing good hand hygiene is essential for maintaining overall health and preventing various infections and conditions that can arise from dirty hands.

item.title: Suriya and Trisha’s characters in Suriya45 revealed - 123telugu
item.description:
Suriya and Trisha’s characters in Suriya45 revealed

Published on: Dec 14, 2024 11:07 am IST

The makers of Suriya45 have announced that Trisha will play the female lead alongside Suriya, marking their first collaboration in 19 years. Both actors will portray lawyers in this upcoming rural entertainer directed by RJ Balaji.

  • Trisha returns to share screen space with Suriya after nearly two decades.
  • Suriya and Trisha will both be portraying lawyer characters in the film.
  • This marks Suriya's third portrayal of a lawyer in his last four films.
  • The film is produced by SR Prakash Babu and SR Prabhu under Dream Warrior Pictures.
  • Sai Abhyankar is the music composer for Suriya45.
“Suriya is donning the lawyer’s role for the third time in his last four movies.”

Suriya45 is generating excitement among fans as it promises to be a captivating rural entertainer. Further updates are anticipated as the film progresses toward its release.
